    • Method Detail

      • getMac

        public byte[] getMac(byte[] input)
        Returns the Message Authentication Code from the input. By default it returns the first 32 byte as SHA256 describes.
        Parameters:
        input - The data from which to extract the Message Authentication Code
        Returns:
        The 32 byte SHA256 Message Authentication Code

      • getTimeStamp

        public byte[] getTimeStamp(byte[] input)
        Returns the timestamp from the given message
        Parameters:
        input - The timestamp, stripped from the input
        Returns:

      • getNonce

        public byte[] getNonce(byte[] input)
        Returns the Nonce from the input. By default it returns the first 8 byte as ChaCha20 describes.
        Parameters:
        input - The data from which to extract the Nonce
        Returns:
        The 8 byte ChaCha20 describes

      • getData

        public byte[] getData(byte[] input)
        Returns the inputted data without the crypto header By default it returns input - 32 byte HMAC - 8 byte Nonce.
        Parameters:
        input - The data from which to extract the Message Authentication Code
        Returns:
        The inputted data without crypto header

      • prependMac

        public byte[] prependMac(byte[] mac,
                         byte[] input)
        Prepends the given Message Authentication Code to the Data
        Parameters:
        mac - The Message Authentication code to prepend
        input - The data to which the Message Authentication code should be prepended
        Returns:
        Message Authentication Code prepended to data

      • prependNonce

        public byte[] prependNonce(byte[] nonce,
                           byte[] input)
        Prepends the given nonce to the Data
        Parameters:
        nonce - The Message Authentication code to prepend
        input - The data to which the nonce should be prepended
        Returns:
        nonce prepended to data

      • verifyMac

        public boolean verifyMac(byte[] key,
                         byte[] input,
                         byte[] mac,
                         boolean headerPresent)
        Method to verify whether the given Message Authentication code is equal to the Message authentication code calculated from the inputted data. If this method returns true no tampering has occurred given the synchronous key is only known by both sending and receiving party.
        Parameters:
        key - The synchronous key
        input - The data from which to compute a Message Authentication Code
        mac - The Message Authentication code to compare with the computed one
        headerPresent - Boolean whether the given input still has a Message Authentication Code prepended that has to be removed before calculation
        Returns:
        True is Message Authentications are equal, False is they are not

      • generateHMac

        public byte[] generateHMac(byte[] key,
                           byte[] input)
        Generate a Hashed Message Authentication Code with SHA256 from the inputted data and the given synchronous key
        Parameters:
        key - The synchronous key
        input - The data from which to calculate a Message Authentication Code
        Returns:
        The Message authentication code calculated from the input with the given synchronous key

      • createRandom

        public byte[] createRandom(int length)
        Function that enables crypto class to secure random numbers
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the desired random number
        Returns:
        A sequence of random numbers with the provided length

      • createKey

        public byte[] createKey()
        Method for creating a KEY_SIZE-bit secure random key for usage as Message authentication key and data encryption key
        Returns:
        A 256-bit key

      • createNonce

        public byte[] createNonce()
        Method for creating a NONCE_SIZE-bit secure random Nonce
        Returns:
        A 64-bit nonce

      • encryptWithAESGCM

        public byte[] encryptWithAESGCM(byte[] key,
                                byte[] nonce,
                                byte[] data)
        Encrypt using AES_Keysize X_GCM
        Parameters:
        key - variable keysize (128,192,256)
        nonce - The 12 bit nonce
        data - The plaintext to be encrypted
        Returns:
        the encrypted plaintext, the ciphertext

      • decryptWithAESGCM

        public byte[] decryptWithAESGCM(byte[] key,
                                byte[] nonce,
                                byte[] data,
                                byte[] timestamp)
        Decrypts the ciphertext to the plaintext
        Parameters:
        key - The cryptographic key
        data - The ciphertext
        nonce - The 12 bit nonce
        timestamp - The timestamp prepended to the ciphertext
        Returns:
        The ciphertext decrypted, the plaintext

      • setCipher

        public void setCipher(int cipher)
        Changes the cipher used to encrypt the data that encrypts the stream
        Parameters:
        cipher - The enumerated cipher choice

      • encryptMessage

        public byte[] encryptMessage(byte[] data)
        Encrypts a messages using the selected cipher choice
        Parameters:
        data - The data that should be encrypted
        Returns:
        the ciphertext from the given plaintext that can be transmitted over a network securely

      • decryptMessage

        public byte[] decryptMessage(byte[] key,
                             byte[] data)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        get the content of an encrypted message
        Parameters:
        key - The symmetric cryptographic key
        data - The encrypted message
        Returns:
        The plaintext message, decrypted from the ciphertext
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getKey

        public byte[] getKey()
        Debug purpose key retrieval
        Returns:
        The current cryptographic key

      • setKey

        public static void setKey(byte[] key)
        Sets the cryptographic key to the parameter
        Parameters:
        key - The key that should be used as the new cryptographic key

      • createTimeStamp

        public byte[] createTimeStamp()
        Method that creates a timestamp. Used to prevent replay attacks and is prepended to the ciphertext for that purpose
        Returns:
        The current time as a timestamp

      • validateTimeStamp

        public boolean validateTimeStamp(byte[] timeStamp)
        Validates whether the timestamp presented is within the allowed timeframe
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - The presented timestamp
        Returns:
        True if the presented timestamp is whithin the allowed timeframe, false otherwise

      • exchangeKeyServer

        public void exchangeKeyServer(java.lang.String[] allowed)
        Starts the TLS exchange in the sever perspective
        Parameters:
        allowed - list of parties including their allowed timeframes

                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Attempts to retrieve a key from the stream server
        Parameters:
        targetip - IP-address of the server
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
